</div><!-- /.page-lead-content. -->

<div class="tiles">

<div class="tile">
<h2 class="post-title"><i class="fa fa-book fa-2x"></i> Project</h2>
<p class="post-excerpt">
The Baltic Health Index is a regional study applying the Ocean Health Index framework. The aim is to initiate the development of an integrative and transparent tool that can be used by decision-makers to guide management of the Baltic Sea region towards increased sustainability.

</p>
</div>

<div class="tile">
<h2 class="post-title"><i class="fa fa-cubes fa-2x"></i> Our team</h2>
<p class="post-excerpt">
The Baltic Health Index is a project jointly led by [Stockholm Resilience Centre (SRC)](http://www.stockholmresilience.org/) and [Baltic Eye](http://www.su.se/ostersjocentrum/baltic-eye) at the Baltic Sea Centre, both at Stockholm University.

</p>
</div>

<div class="tile">
<h2 class="post-title"><i class="fa fa-globe fa-2x"></i> Ocean Health Index </h2>
<p class="post-excerpt">
The Ocean Health Index ('OHI') is a scientific framework to measure how healthy oceans are. Understanding the state of our oceans is a step towards their being able to continue providing humans benefits now and in the future. Learn more at [ohi-science.org](http://ohi-science.org).

</p>
